description.en:
- Programming with Elixir

objectives.en: The objective of this course is to introduce an agile method for software development that takes advantage of the principles of cloud computing and software as a service.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on tutvustada väledat tarkvaraarenduse meetodit, mis tooks esile  pilvearvutuse ja tarkvara kui teenuse eeliseid

learning_outcomes.en:
On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
1. Discuss the challenges and opportunities of developing software using the cloud.
2. Carry out a software project from conception to deployment.
3. Apply agile development techniques, including user stories, behaviour-driven development, continuous integration, and deployment on the cloud.
4. Effectively work in a software development team
learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse edukal läbimisel oskab tudeng:
1. Arutleda tarkvaraarenduse pilve kasutamise probleemide ja võimaluste üle.
2. Läbi viia tarkvaraprojekti ideest teostuseni.
3. Rakendada väledaid arendusvõtteid nagu kasutuslood, käitumisjuhitav
arendus, pidevintegratsioon ja evitus pilves.
4. Töötada efektiivselt tarkvaraarendusmeeskonnas.

independent_work.et: The instructions are given on page https://courses.cs.ut.ee/

description.et: Three homework assignments are required. The assignments must be submitted on time and satisfy the requirements.
The project is evaluated by considering the completed requirements, the quality of the project implementation presented, and the evidence of agile practices.

grade_preconditions.et:
There will be three assessment items:
- Students will complete 3 homework assignments (10 points in total).
- Students will develop a web application in teams by applying the agile practices promoted during the course (40 points).
- Final exam (50 points)

A mark on the final of exam of 20 (out of 50) points or less will be mapped into a final fail grade (F). 
On the other hand, with a mark of 21 or more points in the final exam, the final grade will be calculated as the sum of the points earned from the continuous assessment and the final exam. The resulting sum (out of 100) will be mapped to a grade between A and F using the standard University scale.

grade_evaluation.et:
There will be three assessment items:
- Students will complete a 3 homeworks (10 points in total).
- Students will develop in teams a software system by applying the agile practices promoted during the course (40 points).
- Final exam (50 points)

A mark on the final of exam of 20 (out of 60) points or less will be mapped into a final fail grade (F). On the other hand, with a mark of 21 or more points in the final exam, the final grade will be calculated as the sum of the points earned from the continuous assessment and the final exam. The resulting sum (out of 100) will be mapped to a grade between A and F using the standard University scale.

debt_elimination.et: One supplementary exam will be offered to students who are unable to attend the first exam or who fail the first exam.
